On Fri, 2003-11-07 at 09:28, Gordon Mohr wrote:

> I note that your pattern allows '-' in domains -- which
> is technically not allowed but occasionally used and supported
> by most software. Right now, the java.net.URI class refuses
> URIs with dashed hostnames, so we can't crawl them. See this
> bug:
> 
>   http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=808270&group_id=73833&atid=539099
> 
> We'll eventually implement some workaround, because we
> want to be just as lenient as popular web browsers in
> these situations.

Occasionally?  Fully 22% of registered danish domains have a '-' (as of
30/04/2002 (newest list we have)).  Also, according to RFC 1035, '-'
(dash) is allowed, but the bug above talks about '_' (underscore), which
is a different matter entirely.

-Lars
